availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Woodcock (Pulaski County, KY, cabinetmaker, quartermaster (U.S.A.) )

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and soldier. Kentucky native. Cabinetmaker in 1850. Served in the 43rd Regiment Kentucky Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as quartermaster in Frankfort and in the the 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from November 26, 1862 until his resignation on June 3, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset Division 1, p. 4
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Juggernaut District, p. 268B
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 302.
